column4: is there a way to return all the desktop/menu/panel settings to the default?
nothing works in my normal user but if I make a new one it all works fine
what does not work..?
any program I try to start, it just says "starting __" and then disappears and nothing happens
! tell me about driver
what desktop-manager are you using? the default gnome?
yeah
really haven't changed anything except for addign a few applets to the panel
you said that opening a new user allows you normal work?
yeah everything works fine for the normal user, but not my regular one
hrm, I wiped ~/.gnome2 and ~/.gconf but it didn't fix the problem
I would compare files of the same sort (.something) between the two users...

I have a very ugly solution (that is, if you can't figure a nicer one) - open a new user which has the same sudo permissions as your original and copy all important files form your home to the new one...
need help: I need to use a framegrabber which driver I have for kernel 2.2 only. how can i install the driver in gutsy?
try cancelling the desktop special effects...
they're off, I just copied the .gconf and .gnome2 from the new user to the old one but that hasn't fixed things either
I really don't get it, I wiped the *entire* home of the old user, still nada
which user are you using for that (removing the files)?
root
well, the old one sudoed to root

make sure u have removed the files from the users home and not from root's... I think your user should be logged off to effetively remove the files since gnome is probably recreating the files based on current settings (which are bad...)
